definition: to urge/to press/to prompt/to rush sb/to hasten sth/to expedite
fat/fertile/loose-fitting or large/to fertilize/to become rich by illegal means/fertilizer/manure

sentences.english: Store-fed animals are fed on maize, wheat and barley in the race to fatten them up as fast as possible.
sentences.chinese: 圈養牲畜則是用玉米小麥和大麥儘快的催肥而成的。

sentences.english: We're fattening the livestock up for slaughter.
sentences.chinese: 我們正在催肥牲畜待宰殺。

sentences.english: The herdsman drove afield battening his flocks with the fresh dews of night.
sentences.chinese: 牧人把羊羣趕到野外，用夜晚的新鮮露水催肥。

sentences.english: Those pigs are being fattened up for market.
sentences.chinese: 這些豬正在被催肥以拿到市場上出售。

sentences.english: Your host want to kill you when you become fat and strong.
sentences.chinese: 你的主人是想等你催肥後，殺掉你。

sentences.english: Because female hormones fatten the body, they are used to fatten livestock.
sentences.chinese: 由於女性激素催肥軀體，因此也用於催肥牲畜。

sentences.english: Because female hormones fatten the body, they are used to fatten livestock.
sentences.chinese: 由於女性激素催肥軀體，因此也用於催肥牲畜。

sentences.english: The pigs are being fattened up for market.
sentences.chinese: 這些豬正在被催肥待售。

definition: (of livestock) to fatten up/to put on weight
to feed (a child, domestic animal etc)/to keep/to raise (an animal)
to feed livestock with highly nutritional food in order to fatten them up in a short time
to rear (an animal) in an enclosure
variant of 仔豬|仔猪[zi3 zhu1]
to forage/to gather for eating/to pick and eat
